title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: There were several interviews with multiple persons. Everything was set up well, there were several work-related and general (e.g. motivation) questions. I had the feeling that the communication was very good and all questions that also I had were sufficiently answered.
Interview Questions: What motivates you to do a good job? Describe a situation where you had to deal with a difficult person.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: There isn't an interview for me. I was in the accelerated program so this process is waived. Very friendly faculty and very helpful TAs. You will enjoy every single day being here.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted on zoom with 2 professors and a fellow interviewee. We were asked questions individually, and it felt like more of a conversation. The interview was conducted with 2 faculty members and 2 potential student candidates.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to attend Stony Brook?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about 12 behavioral questions. The questions were relatively straightforward and it lasted about 30min. The interviewers were very nice because they always gave me encouraging looks when I stutter or forget what to say.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself, strength and weakness

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Review of experience, program offerings and courses. Needed to submit past teaching experience and description of proposed course. Teaching style was discussed as was program expectations for hybrid courses. It was more of a conversation.
Interview Questions: They asked about Past teaching experience and teaching style.

title: Residence Hall Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: 3 step interview. Zoom with formal questions, then a presentation then an on-campus interview. Once you're to the point where you're in the process of your on-campus interview, they're pretty sure about you getting the job. Here you will interview with some of the leaders of the department, so it's important to put your best foot forward.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you effectively handled a crisis.

title: Student Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Good overall, asked several questions regarding my experience and availability which were based on the resume I submitted, discussed the position and requirements for the job, introduced the work environment
Interview Questions: What experience will you bring

title: Extension Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of two interviews, one with a roleplay presentation and Q&A on a specific topic. The entire process from application to notification of final decision was about one month.
Interview Questions: How would you prioritize stakeholder needs?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: My experience included an intensive and lengthy interview process, without follow-up from employer. They prepared questions ahead of time that they reported would be asked for all candidates. Though equalizing, I found this to be a limiting experience that left me feeling like I did not have the opportunity to discuss my skills.
Interview Questions: I interviewed with the employer several months ago and don't recall.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Contacted a professor and heard back from them. Proceeded with a zoom call to learn more and answer a few questions. Only one step and after job was offered that counted as a work study for school
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in research?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: very smooth because it involved a lot of communication between the both of us and they made you feel very comfortable with them. they did not make it seem as if they are there to test you. they made it seem like they want to just get to know you and your fit for the job.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths in this field?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview that was very relaxed and just wanted to have a conversation. Asked the usual interview questions.  Met with 2 faculty members from the department and then a general zoom session with other students who were also interviewing.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions:
meeting with supervisor and talking with former intern
basically asking and answer and also they described how intern works. Friendly and Nice. It was less than 30 min. Interviewed alone not a group interview.
Interview Questions: Who is your mentor? and why

title: RSP Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Online meeting done on availability of schedule for patrolling, benefits and miscellaneous duties made known. Not a difficult interview process, job duties important to the community and physical duties might be strenuous to some.
Interview Questions: Asked about early shift availability

title: Residential Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Short interview conducted via Zoom with two staff members about experience, reasons for applying, and scope of the position. Conversational interview with helpful insight into the roles, duties, and expectations for the shifting department.
Interview Questions: Briefly go through how you would handle managing multiple student interns in the marketing and communications department.

title: Senior Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Three part interview process, very clear. First part is a proposal, second part is group interview, third part is individual interview. Each part weeds out more people. I found the interview process enjoyable.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student was dissatisfied with a service at an event?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very equitable and transparent. The questions were sent in advance, and no comments were made about taking notes. No belittling, and everyone was very kind. The interview was easy to set up and everyone did the best they could as it was during COVID.
Interview Questions: What is your view of public health?

title: ICU Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone call.  The woman was very informative about the position and helpful with my questions. She offered me a virtual interview later in the month.  It is for a virtual interview day through zoom.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to be in the surgical intensive care unit?

title: Housing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The first phone interview was 30 minutes and then I went to an in-person interview which was and hour and a half. This consisted of two 30-minute interviews with both of the people who interviewed me on the phone and a 30-minute panel interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you went above and beyond for a customer.

title: Social Media Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very easy and the questions were basic. However, was told I would hear back in the first weeks of January and never heard anything. We take our time to apply and interview and getting no response after our interview is degrading.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous experience in Social Media?

title: Desktop Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was simple and straight to the point. Get to know who you are as a person and some technical skills when it comes to diagnosing and/ or fixing things.
Interview Questions: How would you explain what a hard drive is to someone who doesn't know what a hard drive is.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: short and quick didn't  go into technical questions. ask  the basic questions tell me about  yourself and why stony brook. What you see yourself doing in 5 years .  how did you hear about us and what leadership means to them
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself and why stony

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with several of the employees in my department as well as the then-current postdocs.  Was presented with a vignette scenario and asked to interpret it.  Took a tour of campus.  Had the opportunity to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in Stony Brook?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process went well. Due to COVID-19 there were precautions taken and the interview was held in the conference room. The HR Manager, and Director asked me questions regarding my past experience. I also learned more about the department and what the position entails.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Front Desk OA Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Prepare a good cover letter and try to iterate points mentioned in the same. And try to mention instances of your past experience and how it would help you during your work for that job
Interview Questions: What was the most intriguing experience during your past job?

title: Nursing Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: applied online and interviewed at stony brook university. professors were welcoming and the environment was not so strict. very relaxed interview; group interview. Asked why I chose nursing and my background.
Interview Questions: why did you choose nursing

title: IT Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Short, to the point. Interviewer was very nice. Talked about my past experience with computers. Asked for my major. Asked very generic interview questions. He also talked about what we would be doing and who we would be helping.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with computers before?

title: Research Technician III Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: A committee called me for a 15 minute screening for my qualifications. One interviewer was friendly, the other silent (research tech), and the third was extremely condescending (PI). He told me that because I'd never lived in Long Island, I was 'relying on the internet' to know what employment there would be like, as if it never having lived there made me unqualified to apply to the job. He also used acronyms specific to the job and laughed at me for asking what they meant. I think it was pretty clear that I was not a real candidate for the job and that they were screening me as a formality. My guess is that they already had a candidate lined up. I was offered a second-round interview but declined because the screening was so off-putting.
Interview Questions: Have you ever lived in Long Island before?

title: Assistant Professor of Practice Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions:
Online application, then selected for an interview that included preparing a lecture and a presentation about the research work, followed by many questions about teaching experience and research itself. I was interrupted once during the lecture part but it was for an easy question. 
Several other general questions about background.
Interview Questions: What classes would you be more interested to teach?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with the Continuing Education unit and consisted of a three step interview process; first interview was over the phone; second interview was with unit staff, second interview was with the Assistant Dean of Budget and Finance.
Interview Questions: Tell us how you have dealt with dissatisfied clients or customers.

title: Caregiver, CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Welcoming and comforting. Not too long but not too short. Everyone was very nice. the interview questions had more to do with the job title. I had a good experience!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: RSP Field Unit Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: I was asked several questions about what they thought I would do in several situations that might come up in the job, then asked some weird questions like what kind of fruit I would be if I were a fruit. It was pretty relaxed and straightforward.
Interview Questions: How far do you think you walk in seven hours?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Great interview with short and to-the-point questions that required a superficial understanding of lab techniques like western blot, PCR, and conducting cell culture analysis. Overall, the questions asked to describe the process and how you delivered the tasks expected of you.
Interview Questions: What's your experience with cell culturing?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had a great experience interweiing with them they were very nice and collected people. Welcomed me with open arms and asked about my background and how I am a good fit for the role as whole.
Interview Questions: What are your background expenses like in the field?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Online Video playing music. I had to show very high level of my performance Videos and different styles. From Baroque to 20th century. I played Bach, Vieuxtemps, and Walton .
Interview Questions: Do I have orchestra experience

title: TLT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: group interview run by students; nice concept and good if the interviewers are impartial and give adequate points but likely they have friends who are applying and will give them more points
Interview Questions: How would you design this room to better suit a student's needs on campus?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was super easy. You usually go through 2 short interviews. They asked about very basic questions, like where you live, how you commute, and what your availability is. One question they asked was what you think good hospitality is. You know right after if you are hired or not.
Interview Questions: how you commute, and what your availability?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Personal and quick interview. They are looking for you to check all the boxes. Whatever the job posting lists as requirements is exactly what you need. Was very warm and inviting
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Very quick to respond, very thorough and friendly and gave me opportunity to ask many questions.  Was interviewed by a couple of people, and they gave detailed responses to my questions.  I feel like their description of the job was quite accurate and their questions were very relevant given the position.
Interview Questions: Past experiences related to this one

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Physics is one of the oldest academic disciplines and, through its inclusion of astronomy, perhaps the oldest.[9] Over much of the past two millennia, physics, chemistry, biology, and certain branches of mathematics were a part of natural philosophy, but during the Scientific Revolution in the 17th century these natural sciences emerged as unique research endeavors in their own right.[b] Physics intersects with many interdisciplinary areas of research, such as biophysics and quantum chemistry, and the boundaries of physics are not rigidly defined. New ideas in physics often explain the fundamental mechanisms studied by other sciences[6] and suggest new avenues of research in academic disciplines such as mathematics and philosophy.
Interview Questions: whether I love physics

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: There was an interview with three employees who each took turns asking questions. It was followed by a skills test with written instructions, and I had to create a report with my results.
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself?

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: 3 weeks after the submission deadline, I received a phone call and informed that I was invited to a video-conference interview where we discussed my qualifications and project ideas. Primarily assessed if I was aligned to the mission, vision and the program and the fellowship. The following day, I received a call inviting me to second round of in-person interviews two weeks later. I received a rejection letter a little over a week after the second interview. All in all, a pleasant and straightforward process.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
There was one interview, 
it was in person, 
it was one hour interview, 
two people interviewed, 
they asked for a reference,
Reach there one time,
Practice before the interview
The total procedure was easy
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
What will you change one thing in Stonybrook

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stony Brook University in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
- CV/Resume within 3 pages
- Essay about school contribution & why you want this position
- Letter of recommendation from supervisor/professor/RA
- Online interview
- Group interview
- 1-1 interview with supervisor/RA
- Room and floor selection
Interview Questions:
How can you deal with roommate conflict?
How to prepare a floor program?
How to help new residents?
How to report the sensitive case to school and to floormate?
How to manage the program budget for each semester?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: professor has give me dataset and was asked to remove null values and find suitable model by using different regression techniques and classification techniques. asked many technical questions about data science
Interview Questions:
why this job is suitable for u? 
what is ur experience in data analysis ?
what is v lookup ?
do u have prior experience ?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Emailed back and forth with the manager and met with graduate student for a preliminary interview then met with manager for final interview where the job was described. Was allowed to start the same week as the interview
Interview Questions: What do you do for wellness?

title: Client Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Several different questions were asked to look for skills and for proficiency in IT and customer service related skills. The interview was conducted by 3 people and lasted approximately 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: How do you explain what a hard drive is to a grandma?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The whole process only takes 10 minutes and asked about the basic questions, such as when can you work, have you done the similiar job before. It is quite easy interview process
Interview Questions: What time do you available to work?

title: Work Study Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Just behavior questions, met with a staff and was hired on the spot. Applied online and after a week they got back to me. Had a casual conversation with the building manager and honestly they don't really expect much. Just show up and be yourself, it's just a student position..
Interview Questions: What qualities would make you a good fit?

title: Content Developer and Copywriter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Applied on Handshake. Maybe a week or two later, got an email from my supervisor asking to meet. We scheduled an interview. Found out I'd been accepted over the spring break, we figured out the hours and schedule later.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for/ Why are you interested in this position?

title: Resident Assistant (RA) Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: First you needed to submit your resume and cover letter; you also needed to get recommendations. There was a group interview with collaborative activities. If you got selected from that there was then an interview with three other people in the Campus Residence department, either RAs or professional staff.
Interview Questions: Tell us about one strength and one weakness that you have.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Ask some course questions about the related teaching course.  The recommendation for your reference is important.  You need to show your publications and teaching philosophy.  I received the email from the department of math after interview soon.
Interview Questions: Ask some course questions

title: Physics Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Initially had me in the college of engineering and applied sciences office before moving to a private room where I was asked three basic physics questions and problems. I thoroughly explained the entirety of them and that was it.
Interview Questions: Three basic physics problems and how would I explain it as if the supervisor was a tutor

title: Desk Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was great. It was amazing. The best thing I have done till date. It is so good, I almost can't believe that I have this job. Its the best thing that has happened to me and will probably be the best thing that will ever happen to me.
Interview Questions: Do you walk?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was in person, and was overall very efficient, convenient, and not stressful. The questions were simple, standard and reasonable interview questions. The interview took place on Stony Brook University main campus.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: chill and easy and laid back. no hard question, pretty nice people and staff overall. other people in the office were also nice and welcoming and stuff. flexible time schedule, works around your classes and stuff if you happen to be a student
Interview Questions: why do you want this job?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY)
Interview Descriptions: A whole day interview including group interview, 1:1 interview, lunch interview and presentation.  A lot of professional questions were raised and answered during my presentation. Personality is also very critical.
Interview Questions: Why do you want take this position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: it is positive and very easy. They are very friendly and it took about three weeks to get the offer. And the interview is arranged in Nanjing in China it is about 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: why you want to apply here

title: Research Laboratory Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the professor in charge of the lab over the phone for about 15 minutes. I was asked about previous research experience, goals, and my lab skills. A few weeks after my phone interview, the professor emailed me to ask for three recommendation letters from my references.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stony Brook University in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Nothing out of the ordinary, a few questions about yourself and the job you are applying for. 
Submit an application via email or in person. Make sure to check your email for a response from supervisor and reply about your availability.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: 2 hours interview, discuss about previous experience in CV,  previous paper and writing, raise a question about how to prove a SPD matrix has nonnegative eigenvalues, and something about Fourier analysis
Interview Questions: what is slope limiter used for in hyperbolic conservation law

title: Renovation Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: You pretty much just talk 1v1 one with the of the renovation. I talked to him in his office after class. The interview was casual and short, and the process was relatively quick.
Interview Questions: Whats your experience in management?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Part one was a screening phone call for about an hour to discuss experience, expectations, and future directions.  After invitation to present, I presented to the research group and had one on one meetings with senior members of the team.
Interview Questions: Where would you improve our current methodology

title: Student Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Group interview that highlighted customer service abilities. Ultimately, the process was an exercise of displaying teamwork between strangers and how quickly we can problem solve. Was a quick process where many people were interviewed at once.
Interview Questions: Group exercise on a hypothetical situation on redesigning a student lounge that would encourage student productivity.

title: FSA Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy going.  Multiple steps but no trouble at all. Have documents with you to speed up the process.   However, I wish the setting of the interview was more personal.  Did not appreciate interviewer speaking about my personal life out loud.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: On-Campus Jobs Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Interview Process was like any other interview. Interview included HR Consultant and Students in stage one / stage 2. 
Interview included behavioral/field questions ------------Interviewers were friendly and encouraging. Contact was through email.
Interview Questions: If you were given a time sensitive task while working on another task how would you react?

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Casual, emailed professor of interest about lab openings then met in person. Discussed my interests and their research, met with PhD students and was given a brief outline of work to expect in the lab
Interview Questions: What is your interest in this research?

title: Hazardous Waste Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions:
2 Stage Interview
Stage 1:
Meet the hiring committee as they interview with questions pertaining to the job. I believe in my experience it was an awkward setting, as they asked questions off the script. I want to say it was an awkward experience due to the visual presentation of myself...
Stage 2: Meet the manager

Then you hear back from them.
Interview Questions: What is a 90-day facility

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: the interview took place with two faculty members asking you questions, basically they ask you about you undergraduate thesis, and some of the classes you have taken which relate to the research you'll be doing in your grad school
Interview Questions: Could you describe your research for your undergraduate graduation thesis

title: Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted via email to set up a time to come in and do a writing test. I was given 30-60 minutes to complete the test.
Interview Questions: Write about one of these three topics, in no more than 300 words.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process took 1 week, was offered a position within a week. The interviewing staff were very professional.  They asked behavioral questions like tell me about your self..What do you see yourself in 5 years?
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to apply at  Stonybrook?

title: Stagehand Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: They look through your resume and call the references they need to.  Then they have you come in for an interview with a couple of the higher ups and ask you questions.  If you come in a car, they reimburse you for the garage parking fee.  They are very quick to get back to you.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have with technical theatre?

title: Research Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application online for the Research Support Specialist position, and I was contacted by the principal investigator for an hour-long Skype interview with the PI and the incumbent employee.  Both asked a series of questions that were standard across all candidates, and the questions focused on research experience, supervisory experience, and other experiences related to job duties.  The PI also some information about the job, including how long it was planned to last and the studies being conducted.
Interview Questions: What led you to apply to this position?

title: Desktop Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Several standard behavioral questions with some technician ones, though they specified that candidates does not need to have any technician background.  Some standard questions like how would you explain a hard drive to a non-technician user.
Interview Questions: How to find out the maximum amount of balls a car can fit in?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: It was quick and easy, office was not easy to find especially since the campus is huge. then finding the right room was also difficult. But the whole process was simple fast and straight foward.
Interview Questions: How many hours can you work?

title: TLT Student Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Group interview. They went around the room asking your name, major and one fun fact about yourself. Afterwards, you are split into groups of 4 to work on something together while the senior consultants take notes. Our specific task is to decorate the commuter loungue and we presented as a group when we're finished.
Interview Questions: Name, current standing, major and one fun fact about yourself

title: FSA Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Stony Brook University in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was pretty straightforward. Interview consisted of questions regarding your scheduling, previous experience in food services, and overall future goals.  They ask what you hope to achieve while being a student on campus.
Interview Questions: What are some of your future career goals and how do you think that working for FSA will help prepare you to reach those goals?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Contrary to popular belief, you don't necessarily need a GPA above 3.0 to be a TA.  If you got a good grade in a course, and are on good terms with the professor that is in charge of it, you can wager a shot at asking. Because you get graded credits for being a TA, you can easily use this to boost your GPA.
Interview Questions: Your experience in the course is the most important

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied and received an email the next day requesting to schedule a phone interview. The interview lasted 45 minutes. I followed up 2 weeks later and was told they hadn't made their decision but that I was not one of the top candidates being considered.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to resolve a conflict between other lab members

title: RN Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online March 1, got a call from HR  2 days later to schedule telephone interview  within the week. Interview was with panel of staff and admin, latter about 30 min. Told me to wait for a week for a decision.
Interview Questions: Critical thinking skills based on experience

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly group of people, nice work environment. Easy application: fill out a short Google form, get a recommendation from a professor, and interview with a graduate assistant. I received a decision within ten minutes after my interview.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you suspected a tutee was just trying to get answers on an assignment?

title: Dietary Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Short process, basically offered the job on the spot. Very laid back and simple interview, the interviewer was very kind and friendly. Talked about personality questions a bit and asked me some things about high school and college
Interview Questions: How will your previous experience help you with this potential job

title: Student Custodian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was brief and quick. The HR department was very helpful during the process and it took several week for them to get back to me. For such a simple a job they made such a process for no reason and very low pay.
Interview Questions: what animal do you want to be?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Ask about general questions. No technical problems since the job is easy. The interview is short and easy. They hire 10 graduate students to help them build the platform. Most of them have computer science experiences.
Interview Questions: How will deal with unreasonable people?

title: Grant Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight-forward, explained the details of the job and the process if I was selected to continue on to the next round of interviews. Asked if I had familiarity working with faculty. All in all, a very easy-going, positive experience.
Interview Questions: Why I'm interested in the job, given it was different than my educational background.

title: Desk Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: You are herded into a room with various other people who applied for the Desk Monitor job. Each interview is roughly ten to fifteen minutes long. They'll ask you about previous work experience and how familiar you are with the position.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with the duties of a Desk Monitor?

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a Google form that included the courses I was interested in tutoring and had to answer a couple of short response questions.  To be qualified to tutor a course, a instructor has to provide a recommendation.  After the submission of my application I received a confirmation but had to wait until the recommendation was submitted before being offered an interview.  The interview was straight forward and I had the option of having it in person or through Skype since this was before the school year had started.  There were three Graduate Assistants but they were all very nice and made me feel very comfortable.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tutor?

title: TLT Student Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: One group interview where they asked you to make a team of 3-4 people. You have to work together to come up with a product. It can be anything, they just want to see you do teamwork
Interview Questions: About me

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Conducted by two graduate assistants. They asked me questions regarding my previous tutoring abilities and how I would resolve situations that regarded difficulties with them. Overall, it went similarly to many undergraduate leadership position interviews
Interview Questions: If a student asked you to help them with homework or give them an answer to the homework, what would you have done?

title: Therapy Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions:
straight face to face interview
Four Officials interviewed me
Each one had two or three questions from different perspective.
One person asked me about my consistency in my professional working experience.
Other person asked me about the clinical crisis management situations.
Another question was about a situation and how i would have handled that?
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths and weaknesses?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years from now?
If we Select you, how would you be a productive candidate for the well-being of this institution?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: there's no hiring process for getting a teaching assistant position.  all you do is submit your application online when applying to graduate school.  Only advice i would have is find a professor whose research you are interested in.  This is advice for any school you apply to
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lead Operations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: SImple interview basic qustions it was fast and easy going it didnt require a lot of experience because training is provided. Training consisted of three days and was paid training so that was a positive as well
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Patient Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a lengthy process which included several interviews.  One interview was with a panel of five persons.  Every person sitting around the table had to ask questions of me.  It was a bit unnerving, but having interviewed for other positions I felt prepared for this one.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are the best candidate?

title: Graduate Facilities Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Conducted by a Facilities Manager and a Graduate Facilities Manager. They presented the roles and responsibilities of the position during the interview. The questions were fair and seemed to be aimed at discovering the type of person you are.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to overcome an obstacle.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty regular, I had to hand in my resume first and then they emailed me back 2 days later for an interview and just asked questions like why im a good fit for the job, etc
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for the job?

title: Computer Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Group interview that generally looks for teamwork and computer knowledge. The interview is a large group interview of between 20 to 30 candidates. Questions are asked around the room until you move into a group setting of about 3 to 4 candidates each. Your group is assigned a task to complete testing your leadership and teamwork skills.
Interview Questions: How are you a team player

title: Career Counseling Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 stages: you have to apply by submitting a cover letter and resume on handshake, then  get interviewed by one of the HR interns, then get interviewed by 2 of the supervisors. Then, there was also a group interview which was the most intimidating. Overall it was a smooth process, and they really just want to find someone who is qualified but also would fit in with their work culture, so be yourself.
Interview Questions: Describe step-by-step how you would make a peanut-butter sandwich

title: Dining Hall Job Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was no formal interview. Jus t met with the recruiter and she asked me to briefly describe myself and have my documents to work. The whole process was quick and easy.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience working the registry, working behind the kitchen and etc?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Skype interview with my supervisor, he asked about courses that I've passed and my projects and I've explained my projects
Skype interview with my supervisor, he asked about courses that I've passed and my projects and I've explained my projects
Skype interview with my supervisor, he asked about courses that I've passed and my projects and I've explained my projects,
Interview Questions: Courses that I've passed and my projects

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: We make an assignment by email. After few days, I meet the professor in his office and talk about some possible projects ongoing. I make an introduce of myself. Professor get to know what my interest and my ability is.
Interview Questions: Discuss project.

title: Traffic and Production Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was first called in for an interview with a research committee. About three weeks later, I was called back for a second interview with the Director of the dept. I was told that I would hear from HR whether I got the job or not. I never heard anything.
Interview Questions: Research committee asked how I had handled negative feedback at a previous job.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: pretty chill experience. group and individual interview. there are 3 RAs and at least 1 pro staff member interviewing you. I believe this system has changed though. the class that's now required seems like a better idea. they get to know you better this way. talk to your RHD so that  you're not just a random person applying
Interview Questions: how would you reach out to a quiet resident

title: Research Scientits Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went well. I have interesting questions such as "Where do you see yourself in the next 5 years". I feel comfortable to share my ideas and join the team
Interview Questions: WHat is your plane for future career

title: RSP Field Unit Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I sat down with the student director of the program and he asked a list of standard questions, marking down the answers. He could not vary from that list of questions, so if I didn't answer one in a pre-approved format, I had to answer it again.
Interview Questions: On a scale of 1 to 10, how would you rate your interpersonal skills?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
One interview with a panel of three committee members for the first round. In the second round, a full day of interviews with a vice president, a department head, and the rest of the department (i.e. the folks who would be your peers). 

First round was a fairly easy interview, with friendly and professional interview committee members. There was about a month between the first round and the second round. In the second round, it didn't seem like the team was prepared to hold interviews. They were confused about the interviewing schedule and each part began significantly late (first interview of the day was something like 20 minutes late, the second was almost an hour late). During the interview, it became clear that the job requirements they actually had differed from the job description. When interviewing with the team that would have become my peers, you could sense the palpable fear they had for the leadership in the department as well. 

I never heard back regarding an offer. I figured out that I didn't get it when I received a notification email stating that the requirements in the job that I had applied to had changed and to reapply if I was still interested. After checking, they had re-posted it with slightly different requirements. This wasn't a very professional way for me to find out, especially since I had made it to the final round of interviews and had taken time off from work to do so.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years? Tell me the best part about Stony Brook.

title: Human Resource Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview, very pleasant and thorough.  It was a almost an hour before we discussed all the questions they had.  A lot of standard questions, typical in 'sample' interview.  With a State institution that is to be expected. Then was interviewed by Human Resource Manager - wonderful person.  She asked the same questions as the interview just prior.  Even though I was not fortunate enough to secure the position, the experience of the interview was invaluable.
Interview Questions: How to deal with difficult people or situations.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Meet with the professor, talk about your previous project and discuss your research interest. It's very easy, just to see if you fit each other or not, not like a job interview.
Interview Questions: Describe your research project during your undergraduate

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: First I was introduced to the position on campus job fair. The application was submitted through university internal career website 'handshake'. I got a call back from the employer within two weeks and after fairly casual interview, i got the job. Working for them for about a year now.
Interview Questions: Basic HTML/CSS knowledge test. Also asked my familiarity with CMS platform such as Wordpress or Drupal.

title: Desk Monitor RSP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Asked me general questions like why I choose to join RSP, my schedule and my GPA.
The interview took about 15 minutes, in general they will not interview anyone they don't want to hire. So make it easy. RSP supervisors are also SBU students so they will be very kind to you.
You will take a 1.5 hour long training to learn everything you need after you passed the interview.
Interview Questions:
Why I choose RSP as a part time job.
What is my visa status.

title: Residence Hall Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy.It was not that bad. I must admit that it was a little harder than I expected, but I came in well prepared, thus making it easier for me.
Interview Questions: Any leadership positions?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Heard of the job opening from a classmate, she had a friend who previously worked in the department and raved of the great environment, benefits, and flexibility with hours and how the job is great to have as a student, as when it isnt too busy you have time for your school work or anyother work you have to get done.
Interview Questions: What are your hours of availability?

title: Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: I was a student at that time and I applied online. The interview was easy and the manager was very friendly. They asked very general questions and liked that I conveyed enthusiasm and eagerness to learn. I was offered the position that same evening.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took 3 weeks in total. First they had a skype interview and next called me for onsite interview. Onsite interview involved a presentation and meeting with bunch of faculty.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions for me?

title: Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was an online application and then in person interviews which lasted about 1 hour. The entire process was fairly simple. Questions were personality based, with one or two scenario based questions to gauge "technical" ability.
Interview Questions: If you felt a situation became out of your control, who would you contact?

title: Telephone Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Ten minute interview, short and easy. They asked me a few questions about my background and experience. They talked to me about the job and then they hired me. It was a pretty good interview experience, but I was a student at the university so it seemed like they were likely to hire a student at the unviersity for the job.
Interview Questions: Are you really good at editing?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Uploaded resume, SoP and other credentials regarding my B.Sc. degree. Started communicating with a professor here and got accepted a month later. The questions mainly covered my research background, which I highlighted in my Statement.
Interview Questions: Research experience was really important.

title: Desk Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a walk in interview event. There were many students lined up outside of one of the lounges where multiple table were set up to interview many people at once. The interview was short and to the point where I sat with two individuals who took turn asking questions.
Interview Questions: If you were a fruit, what fruit would you be?

title: Barista Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: A 20min skype call, had some technical issues during the call but overall it was easy. I didn't have to prepare much and my manager was great from the start. I liked my coworkers but the company itself would be better if they gave more perks to their staff.
Interview Questions: Basic- tell me about yourself, past job experiences

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: The overall hiring and interview process was very positive; created relaxed atmosphere and promoted wanting input.  Initial interview was with a panel and second interview with selecting official and superior.
Interview Questions: Why work here if you are overqualified

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was scheduled with 5 people. They asked specific questions about the job which I answered well. I passed the first one and was chosen for the final interview with another candidate. The second interview was with more senior staff and they asked more general questions. I didn't get the offer in the end.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself?

title: Teaching Assistant/Stony Brook University Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: I'm international student. The director came to China to make the interviews. The whole process is much easier than I thought, most of the questions are basic information, why you interested, etc.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Single interview,with the apartment living coordinator(ALC) at schomburg commons.. It lasted twenty minutes. Fairly simple questions,nothing too difficult. Mainly questioned regarding working hours. I found out about the job via an email and directly met the ALC to enquire about it.
Interview Questions: No question was particularly difficult.

title: Client Support Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my work experiences dealing with customers. I didn't have a strong technical background, but the interviewees were able to overlook this because they needed more students working. They were very polite and interested in my background.
Interview Questions: Q: What strategy would you employ if you were following procedure and a personal computer's memory was wiped? Would you feel comfortable explaining this to a fellow student?

title: Food Show Reporter Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was referred to this job by the producer of the food show and was asked to apply based on my broadcast experience. I then emailed my resume video clips to the FSA manager and was asked to come in for an interview. I then met with producer and FSA manager and answered questions on experience.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with a team?

title: E Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application and came highly recommended. The interviewer knew me and had worked with me on another project. He admitted I was a perfect match for the job and was convinced I would do very well then proceeded to tell me he would be spending a tremendous amount of money on his "clients" dinner and my salary would be $10/hr. Period.
Interview Questions: How do I handle difficult customers?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Not very lengthy, relatively straight forward. I worked at the university while I was a student so I'm not sure how useful my information is. I worked under the division of campus residences. They were organized well enough to function on a regular basis but problems arose on a fairly regular basis.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Just a few email back and forth
Interview Questions: Some background infomation

title: Senior Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Committee members do the initial interviews for professional positions; and if considered a good fit, candidate will be asked to return for second interview to meet with the department head.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Athletic Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, flew me out, whirlwind of meeting the staff and seeing facilities. There and back in under 48h. Met with individuals within the department. Met with the coaching staff and administrators. Then there was a hiring committee.
Interview Questions: How would people you work with describe you? Phone interview, flew me out, whirlwind of meeting the staff and seeing facilities. There and back in under 48h. Met with individuals within the department. Met with the coaching staff and administrators. Then there was a hiring committee.

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: GRE and TOEFL are a must. The GRE level should be above 95% percentile. Good communication skills are also a must. They called me from the GPD office in order to get to know me better and the interview was friendly enough.
Interview Questions: Why is my GRE so low?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: just find a group which you are interested in and talk to the leader of the group. Better to have a good GPA and background knowledge. Passion for their work will be a plus.
Interview Questions: why do you choose Stony Brook

title: Multimedia and EPortfolio Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the zebranet and got the interview in Janaray. Basically , they asked your understanding of eportfolio and went over your resume. After two days, I got the offer and they gave me the paper work and asked me to fill it out
Interview Questions: How many students did you teach ?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: You have to go through the admission process of the university. It is similar to the procedure followed by other universities. You submit your resume, all official transcripts, GRE scores and TOEFL scores if you need to, a personal statement indicating who you want to work with and why and have 3 professors send a recommendation letter for you to the university. This procedure should be done by mid december and you will get an answer around april.
Interview Questions: no questions asked

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line through the  campus residences' website during the end of the Fall semester. Afterwards, I was invited to a group interview process where we had a team builder activity that was monitored by a few RA's and an RHD. Next, I was invited for the individual interview process. Here I sat down with an RHD and two other RA's and they asked me general questions like, Why do I want to be an RA. In addition, the asked me situational question such as What would I do if there were two roommates having a conflict about keeping their suite clean. About two weeks later I received an email stating that I got the position.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to be an RA.

title: Systems Support Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward. Questions about my previous computer knowledge to gauge if I would be able to comprehend the environment. I was also asked if i was interested in learning and working with various servers and environments. It was clear that I wasnt as tech savvy as most applicants, but i displayed a willingness to learn and eagerness to be better.
Interview Questions: Have I ever worked with servers before?

title: Supervising Programmer/Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions:
Application over SBU job's site.  I heard back from them a month later on scheduling an interview.  The interview was a panel interview with a Senior Programmer/Analyst, a Director of Finance, and a Director of Risk Management.  They had a predetermined set of questions and each member of the panel asked their "3rd" of questions.  The Senior Programmer/Analyst took out his mobile and started texting or emailing after he was done which was not flattering.  In addition, per the job description, the job had a great number of "managerial" responsibilities and the requirement of "Application programming experience of one or two languages".  During the interview I was told that the role was more a 50-50 role (between management and technical) but neither on the job description nor the interview they provided any additional info on what other technologies are used and a candidate should posses to get this job.


PS. This is a state job so make your own conclusions!
Interview Questions: What would my colleges describe you as and what would your manager describe you as?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the professor I was working on a project for. Hiring was mainly based on my experience and background. I was lucky enough to have done a project similar to the one the job needed.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Computer Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Students are invited for a group interview. In hindsight, it was not too stressful at all. I don't remember the specific questions asked but the interview itself consisted of a group of at least 8 people.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was really straightforward, and a great place to start. It was a very chill environment. I sat down with the boss of the person I would be working for in her office. The first ten minutes were her getting to know me as a student. We talked about the job requirements and made sure to let me know that they strive towards a work/study balance for students.
Interview Questions: How will this position allow you to succeed as a student at SBU?

title: Desk Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was fortunate enough to be recommended by my brother for the position. Therefore, the interview process was very light and consisted of very basic questions. Since the requirements for the job was next to nothing, I got the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by email to schedule a phone interview. The interview which was conducted by a panel of about five people went great. The interviewers asked about my qualifications and interest in the position. they also clarified salary expectations and tried to gauge my commitment to a long term employment.
Interview Questions: One interviewer asked about my citizenship which was unexpected at this stage of the process.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: just some questions about image processing and MRI techology
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Undergraduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very brief and short, either over the phone or in person. Asks a few questions regarding personal schedule and availability. Asks what the individual is capable of doing ie moving furniture.
Interview Questions: What times are you available

title: Telnet Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stony Brook University
Interview Descriptions: Mass hire, interview process was a breeze
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Helpdesk Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Easy question asked from the opening position manager. For example, what is your major, what is your GPA, how many credits you are taking, What year you in, what are the best hours for you to work.
Interview Questions: Have you even work on campus before

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The committee, consisted by the advisor and several other professors from the same department, asked the basic questions in my major, as well as other questions, like why do you choose our school et al.
Interview Questions: Which aspect of Stony Brook do you like?

title: Cashier At the SAC - Sea-wolf Marketplace Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very informal in the Student Activities center, quick, easy, painless. It was typical of a part time, cashier job. I was interviewed by the two managers and they were able to answer all my questions, but could've been a little more easy going. They managed to answer all of my questions when I had them, though the whole processed seemed a bit rushed, as if they may have been underhanded (which after working there I totally understand why).
Interview Questions: How do you feel about balancing school and work?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was presenting my research project  inside the laboratory, I was meeting the supervisor and the colleagues. The interview process was very comfortable and friendly. The duration was about 3-4 hours.
Interview Questions: Questions about the research and career aspirations

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: submit online, interview on site; nice boss and teammates, fair-difficult questions; and he asked a lot of questions about the technique you use, and your career plan. You need to answer fluently to make the boss trust what you said. Also need to show you have both skills for dry and wet experiments.
Interview Questions: What did you research previously? What is this technology in somewhere of your resume? Do you have a reference? Any publications?

title: Exchange Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: It's the typical university interview process.  You interview on the phone with a committee and then in person with the committee.  Typically, there aren't any one on ones but there can be if you're interviewing to be an Assistant etc.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: They're just looking to see if you're lying on your resume and making sure you're not crazy. If they're interviewing you, you're probably going to get in unless you say something moronic or can't actively discuss what you've put on your resume. Don't make stuff up and don't be crazy. The more boring and results focused you are, the better.
Interview Questions: How are humanized mice made?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Relatively easy. Simple behavioral questions, in some cases asked how the position relates to your goals beyond the university. Some positions require multiple interviews, the first stage of interviews is generally just to screen applicants and make sure they meet all of the requirements for the position.
Interview Questions: How will you manage this position with your courses and other extracurricular activities?

title: Technology Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews. First one with a group of 4-5.  Asks questions based on job posting.  Have storied on experience to talk about for each sentence of the job posting. 2 interview with your boss to see if they like you.
Interview Questions: some questions are not off of the job posting.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: This was not a typical interview process. To get this job I had to be a graduate student at the university. I was already involved with my research group and asked to become a research assistant. After that the process took about a week for my adviser to getting grant funding cleared for my salary.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: We talked about my background, what my projects are about, then professor introduced the projects are currently running in the lab. Finally , he introduce me the environment and lab members to me. I did not have to much conversation withlab members
Interview Questions: what is my background, projects about, where I am from..

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Give a javascript, and ask some general questions and technical questions
Interview Questions: There is no difficult questions.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Feb 2011
