Interview Descriptions: Worked there prior under student accounts.  Job was no longer needed, moved over to systems student assistant.  Interviewed originally for student accounts, no interview needed for moving inter-department
Interview Questions: Prior work experience

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (New York, NY) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: pretty standard like ask about your previous research experiences, why do you want to come here and what labs you are interested here and what else you want to ask me.
Interview Questions: why do you want to come to Stony Brook?

title: Graduate Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with a lot faculty members in my area of interest. Although there were not many options I found one person who was willing to take me as his research assistant. there was no formal interview. I worked in his lab for a semester and he found that I was interested in research.
Interview Questions: Ask you the physical meaning of equations

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions:
pass two exams(common and area tests). tests are held separately. Different track requires different area exams. I was applying for computational applied mathematics track. So, the area exam is based on numerical analysis skill and coding skill.
next, I join one professor's research group and took a small project. when the project was finished, I was recruited. It's not hard if you prepare it. Also, at that time, they have extra funding and need student to contribute the coding skill to the open project.
Interview Questions: you have to understand physics and know the basic stuff of partial differential equations.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer will ask about previous work experience (or lack thereof).
Interview Questions: Not really difficult, but if you haven't had many jobs in the past, be prepared to explain why.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed to see if I have required Mathematical and Computer Science skills for the job of a Research Assistant. A professor interviewed me under whom I was supposed to do research.
Interview Questions: How well you have done in other courses ?

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stony Brook University in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: I applied through their website and was called in for an in-person interview.  I was interviewed by a panel of three employees, making up the official search committee for the position, which is what they seem to put together for all job openings, based on my experience.  They each took turns asking questions and would each take their own notes.  I was then given a quick tour of the department.  I was called back for a second interview with the director of the department, who would be my direct supervisor.  They called each of my references after this meeting and I was offered the position over the phone.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were overly difficult - they were fairly typical questions.  They did ask if I reviewed their website and what I liked and what I would change.  I had taken the time to look, so I had some feedback - I believe they eventually told me I was one of the few candidates that had actually checked it out, which seems like an obvious way to prepare.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Why do you want to be RA?
Interview Questions: What gives you edge over other students?

title: Teach Undergraduate Classes, Grading and Conduct Research With Advisers Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: apply online and received invitation letter to visit campus and talk to department faculty
Interview Questions: Why do you choose stony brook university

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: quick interview some chit chat and review of resume
